entry.title: Combined summary - Bitcoin Core 0.10.0 final was tagged
entry.summary: Bitcoin has released its latest version, 0.10.0, which includes a minor packaging change to avoid tar complications. The release tag for this version is 'v0.10.0'. Builders using Gitian have been encouraged to start building, and a guide has been provided on how to do so, which can be found at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/gitian-building.md. It is recommended that there should be at least three builders, and the binaries must be uploaded before any release announcement is made. The update comes as Bitcoin continues to gain popularity and acceptance worldwide, with more merchants accepting it as a form of payment. As the cryptocurrency becomes more mainstream, it is essential to ensure that it remains secure and stable, hence the need for updates and improvements. Gitian, a system for building deterministic software packages, is used by Bitcoin to ensure that the binaries produced can be verified against the source code. By using Gitian, users can be sure that the code they are running matches the code that has been audited. The use of Gitian also helps to prevent attacks from malicious actors seeking to insert backdoors or other vulnerabilities into the code. Overall, the release of Bitcoin 0.10.0 is a significant step forward in ensuring the continued security and stability of the cryptocurrency. With its increasing adoption, it is crucial to maintain a high level of trust in the system, and regular updates such as this help to achieve that goal.
